metadata.description: Size of the VMs in the VM Scale Set. The default is Standard_F2.
FortiOS version supported by FortiGate autoscale for Azure.
Create a new Virtual Network or use an existing one.
Azure virtual network name.

The prefix each VMSS Name is given when deploying the FortiGate autoscale template. The value of this parameter should be the same as for deploy_funcapp.json. The prefix cannot contain special characters \/""[]:|<>+=;,?*@& or begin with '_' or end with '.' or '-'.
Prefix for IP addresses in the virtual network in CIDR notation. E.g. 10.0.0.0/16.
Public facing subnet 1 name.
Subnet 1 prefix in CIDR notation. E.g. 10.0.0.0/24.
Protected subnet 2 name.
Subnet 2 prefix in CIDR notation. E.g. 10.0.1.0/24.
Private facing subnet 3 name.
Subnet 3 prefix in CIDR notation. E.g. 10.0.2.0/24.
Private subnet 4 name.
Subnet 4 prefix in CIDR notation. E.g. 10.0.3.0/24.
Load Balancer's Front End Private IP for the last octet.  For example: 10.  Then, the Private IP would be 10.0.1.10 in the subnet with prefix 10.0.1.0/24.
Create a new public IP address or use an existing one.
Public IP address name.
The initial number of VM instances in the BYOL VMSS. Maximum is 2.
The initial number of VM instances in the PAYG VMSS.
Maximum number of VM instances in the PAYG VMSS.
Percentage of CPU utilization at which scale-out should occur.
Percentage of CPU utilization at which scale-in should occur.
FortiGate administrator username on all VMs.

FortiGate administrator password on all VMs. This field must be between 11 and 26 characters and must include at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one digit, and one special character such as (! @ # $ %).
Auto-Scale App service URL. No trailing slash. For example, https://fgt-app-serv.azurewebsites.net.
